meanings.definition: To choose or select one person or thing from a group
meanings.sent1: She was singling out the best student for the award.
meanings.sent2: The coach was singling the player with the most potential for extra training.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was singling out the class clown for a special role in the school play.
meanings.sent4: The detective was singling out the key suspect in the lineup.
meanings.sent5: The chef was singling out the freshest ingredients for the special dish.

meanings.definition: The act of separating or isolating someone or something
meanings.sent1: The singling of the troublemaker from the group was necessary for peace.
meanings.sent2: The singling of the red apple from the green ones made the choice easier.
meanings.sent3: The singling of the noisy toy from the quiet ones was a relief for the parents.
meanings.sent4: The singling of the injured bird from the flock was a sad sight.
meanings.sent5: The singling of the rare flower from the common ones delighted the botanist.

meanings.definition: The process of identifying or focusing on a single person or thing
meanings.sent1: The singling of the star student for the scholarship was a proud moment.
meanings.sent2: The singling of the unique painting from the collection caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The singling of the special ingredient in the recipe added a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: The singling of the fastest runner in the race was a thrilling moment.
meanings.sent5: The singling of the rare gem in the jewelry store amazed the customers.
